title: Great girls weekend
text:
Stayed here one night
Great location, right opposite beach
Modern decor, mezzanine floor
Spacious, poolside view
Chocolates and wine on arrival
Spa bath
Discount food for the Rye Hotel
Walking distance to shops and eateries
Friendly staff
Private parking
Will return
place: Rye Hotel Accommodation - One Four Nelson

title: Lovely eatery
text:
Booked restaurant on a Saturday night to find it very busy.
Under staffed, only one waitress
Meal delicious and very tasty
BYO wine
Worth a visit

title: Entertaining atmosphere
text:
We were away for a sibling getaway and stopped by the Rye Hotel.
Despite not eating there, we enjoyed the solo artist that performed, he engaged the crowd well.
Small pokies area, bar attendance great, clean amenities, well positioned in main street.

title: 1st glamping experience
text:
I'm.so excited to say that my first ever glamping experience exceeded my expectations.
Hosts Lucy and Josh and gorgeous daughter Harriet are very welcoming , friendly, professional and Josh is an amazing cook.
The glamping tents have all the comforts, amazing soft queen bed, quality linen, mood lighting, outdoor chairs, solar lightening , charging station, decor tasteful.
Very warm and cosy, small heater if needed.
Situated on a beautiful property with all the country charm.
Large gums, picturesque scenery, wildlife, clean amenities, amazing camp kitchen, fire pit.
If you're looking for a new experience close to town this is it.
Highly recommend, we will be back
Thanks again Josh and Lucy

title: Waterfall breathtaking
text:
We drove up to Snobs falls and didn't expect the falls to be flowing so heavily
Very picturesque, some gorgeous fungi on the trees as well as bird life.

title: Well presented park
text:
We decided last minute for a getaway and decided to take our two dogs for their very first caravan experience.
The staff were very friendly, accommadating and professional.
The park and all the facilities and more.
Dog friendly, jumping pillow, pool, playground, river , games room and children's playground.
There are many different cabins to also choose from with powered and non powered sites.
Lots of dog poo bags scattered throughout the park and its big enough for the dogs to be walked.
You can hire fire pits and buy firewood.
The amenities where we were positioned were entry by key , very clean and modern
There is a general large toilet block without key entry.
Overall it was a lovely friendly park, with all the comforts.
Well equipped camp kitchen as well.
We are definately coming back.
Thanks Nola for making out getaway possible.

title: Won't return
text:
My partner and I visited here for the first time on the weekend
What appeared a dated exterior, we were surprised to find a modern interior.
Staff were friendly on arrival and we requested to sit out on the lower deck outside, was far too windy for the upper deck
Drinks overpriced so we only had one each
Meal service quick but the chicken Parma was small and the chips had no flavour.
Unfortunately the side salad was bland and not very well presented.
I paid $30 for the calamari and chips which wasn't a disappointment.
Despite the calamari being tender and yes I we won't be returning, overpriced for pub meal

title: Lovely afternoon out
text:
First time visiting the brewery with my partner
Lovely, friendly staff on arrival
Intimate space not over crowded
Choice of indoor seating or outdoor
Very rustic, festoon lighting , beautiful trees
Cider very tasty, beer paddle a hit
My partner chose the pork ribs was a little disappointed by the portion size but extremely tasty
Would recommend for small groups or couples
Looking forward too visiting again

title: Beers & cheers
text:
My son decided to meet here for dinner on a Thursday night...
To our surprise we managed to book the last table.
Quite spacious downstairs with a few tables upstairs.
We arent members but enjoy their different specials they have each might of the week...Thursday night's are $14.99 burger and chips compared too $21 normal price.
Meal was great and filling service punctual despite their full eatery.
There is an upstairs sports bar but unfortunately not much of a view.
Plenty of tv large im size adorn the eating area.
The only negative i thought were the pricey drinks.
I'll definately be back, varied ages present.

title: Stylish
text:
Apparently opened for now for 12 months we decided too take my mother inlaw for a country drive, and ended up here.
Despite being the long weekend we got a table.
The decor is tasteful, crisp with many hues of green.
There are 3 areas to the choose from when entering, the main dining area, coffee type lounge and a few tables outside.
The staff are very friendly, all matching attire, they had ran out of almond milk which was disappointing for someone that doesnt drink full cream or soy.
Wine via glass and bottle $$$
Menu was locally sourced, very small dishes and again a little on the pricey side.
Bread was served free with dipping oil, food came quickly and no doubt very tasty.
I admired the concrete flooring, large vases with green and white flowers, high ceilings, well maintained grounds and groves of olive trees made interesting pictures.
The road leading to the grove is gravel for those with prized cars whom cringe of dust and duco chips from small stones.
A lovely place for a special occassion, menu didnt appear kid friendly.

title: Interesting place
text:
We arrived with a group of friends driving panelvans to the Buxton pub.
It was late in the afternoon to find the pub quite empty.
The bar attendant was very social and made us feel welcome. Large bistro out the back, lots of deer heads and quirky signs throughout, small bar with pool table and atari game. Large outdoor deck great to catch up with friends .....
Would highly recommend apparently they even have a free bus too collect people from nearby caravan parks.
Drinks reasonable prices, unsure about meals as we only stopped for a drink...

title: Different
text:
First time on the weekend for my partnera birthday.
Restaurant very quite, prices pricey, staff lovely, recommend seafood pizza.
Not alot of choices for beer.
Outdoor eating area nice
Ordered nutella donuts to be given x 3 small nutella filled donuts for $16
5/10 prob wont return

title: Never disappoints
text:
This is the 4th time i have climbed to Mt Oberon.
The climb is a gradual incline with some steps as you ascend to the top.
There are seats on the way if you need a rest and view points to take in the beauty.
On arrival to the top you are welcomed with spectacular views of the ocean, mountains and tidal river campsite.
Its a great place to gather thoights, take time to breathe it all in and take some memorable snaps. It does get windy at the top so hold onto your hats. Suitable for all age groups and fitness levels.
3km one way on average should take an hr to the top.
Good idea to take hat, water amd sunscreen.
Toilets in carpark at the start.
One not to miss at the Prom

title: Wonderful private walking tour
text:
From the moment we booked our walking tour in Athens with Antosis we felt completely at ease. He is a kind gentle soul with a passion for his home town city Athens. He took us too places that we never would have found on our own and personalised the trip to our liking. His English and communication skills are excellent and I wouldnt hesitate too both another trip with him.
He managed to show us the best gelato place, baklava and souvlaki resturants in town.
Thanks so much Antosis it was a pleasure to meet you

title: Adventure, fun & friendship
text:
I have now completed two overnight hikes with The Hiking Society.
John is very professional and makes the hikes not only interesting and challenging but overall safe and friendly.
John has all the correct safety measures in place for himself and the hiker and caters for all level of fitness.
I feel the business provides a unique speciality providing camping gear guides transport and food for those longer hikes.
The hikes offered are varied in location, distance and grades. John can even provide private hiking for friends for a group of 5 or more.
I thoroughly recommend The Hiking Society for those wishing to start their hiking journey or for the regular enthusiasts that are looking for their next challenge.

title: Overrated
text:
I expected this place tp be the hype of activity, but it smelt and wasnt very appealing. This is the hun of transport for taxis and hop on hop off buses.
It really could do with some life

title: Busy tourist place
text:
My partner and I decided not to go with a tourist company and walk up on our own.
It took 20 mins from our apartment.
Amazing historical place of interest too many tourists.
It cost $20 euro for entry to the Acropolis.
Crowds lined the path but i wasnt missing out.
Worth the visit ...simply breathtaking

title: Unique find in a fantastic location
text:
My partner and I arrived around 930pm bia airport with arranged transportation to the hotel.
On arrival we were greeted by a very friendly gentleman that showed us to our room.
It has 15 rooms over 3 levels with a gorgeous rooftop bar/dining overlooking the Acropolis.
The decor from the moment we stepped inside had the wow factor. Hues of gray white and black filled the corridors and rooms.
Large chandeliers hung from the ceilings with beautiful ceiling roses. We chose a corner balcony suite which was quite spacious with x 3 small balconies opening up to different views of the street.
A gorgeous chime of church bells ring on the hour.
Breakfast was plentiful, not a huge choice but enough for myself and partner.
Great location walking distance to the acropolis , flea market, fresh produce market and historical sites.
Overall very impressed what the suites offer and would highly recommend.
Just be aware of the marnle staircase it can be slippery

title: Nephews birthday
text:
We decided to celebrate my nephew's birthday party on a Sunday night.
It was quite busy suggesting its a great place to eat.
The younger children enjoyed the playground, I was enjoying the craftsmanship of the rock walls featured throughout the dining area. Large timber beams with quirky lighting are also a grrat talking piece.
Well equipped bar at reasonable prices.
The only disappointed was my meal.
I ordered the calamari which was tasteless and smothered with a mix of two different lettuce and dried noodles.
Other family members appeared happy with theirs.
Waitresses were pleasant , we didnt have to pay for cakeage which was a bonus.
Would recommend for large groups.
7/10

title: Blown away
text:
My partner and I decided to make a dinner booking for the bistro on a Saturday night.
Service friendly and swift, well priced, large meals. The complex is very lush with modern decor, swanky bar lounge, frinkle icecream bar, function room, tab, pokies and a room for over 18 Junction, with fires dj and cafe style seating.
We we so impressed by everything, would highly recommend.
Neat casual attire.

title: Last minute getaway ...well worth it
text:
My partner and I decided last minute to escape Melbourne and head to Moama.
The Riverspa apartments ticked all our requirements for what we called a romantic escape.
On arrival we were greeted by a bush setting residing right beside the river, featuring outdoor pool, river side fireplace with surrounding seating, gorgeous manicured gardens and lawn with an ambundance of gums and bird attracting natives.
The apartments are quite well spaced with plenty of room for the car.
On entry to our studio apartment we were taken back at the presentation and cleanliness of our hideaway.
It featured king bed, kitchenette, tv, bathroom with large double spa, outdoor veranda with bbq
Very happy with everthing the apartments offer .
Highly recommend

title: Very busy but worth the wait
text:
I had often ducked into Franks cakes to pick up the odd slice or cake, but this morning we finally decided to sit and have brunch.
Unfortunately despite it being not overcrowded the young lady at the counter said they were under staffed.
It meant we were to order at the counter instead of seated ordering, i gathered our own glasses and jug .
The waitress was doing her best to please everyone, and we didnt end up waiting too long for the meal.
I ordered eggs benedict with ham and my partner had Franks big breakfast.
The presentation was on point as was the taste.
This experience hasnt turned me off eating here again, im actually looking forward to the next time.

title: Deliciousness
text:
My partner and I have been living a few suburbs away for awhile and had heard this place is amazing.
We decided to give it a trial for breakfast one Sunday.
We didnt book, and managed to get the last table for rwo.
It was busy and obviously very popular.
Not only is the resturant busy but there was a continual flow of coffee lovers getting their morning fix.
Lots to choose from the menu , and a small selection of specials also.
The array of cakes, muffins and slices too choose from left me pondering for 15 minutes on what too choose.
Over great service, friendly atmosphere and fantastic value for money..

title: Getaway
text:
We booked the inn for the historical component..built in 1859
Location right in town
Rooms very dated
Beds old wire base very squeaky
Lack of power points in room and the one that was there was right under the bed
Noisy being above a pub
Good views from balcony
Close too beach
Amenities clean showers hot
Communial lounge with small fridge
You pay for what you get
Disappointed

title: Mother nature at its best
text:
My mum and I wwnt to visit the Mareeba rock wallabies at Granite Rock.
You enter via a camping ground.
Unfortunately we couldnt do the complete walk due too flooding.
You can buy a bag of feed for $2 to feed the wallabies and we also got to feed mother and her baby peacocks.
There are other animals and birds of interest to view ...
Overall great afternoon out.
Suited for all group types

title: Great selection, fresh food
text:
9 of us turned up to get some lunch
Lovely bakery with all the trimmings
Good food, can eat inside or outside
Friendly staff
Recommend the foccias

title: Great central spot
text:
Our hiking leader booked this park for a night while we explored Rollasons falls and Mt Beauty.
Great location, 10 min drive too Bright.
The park.is clean, spacious and has a mixture of permanent sites, tents, caravans powered and unpowered.
There were 9 of us camping, they positioned us near gorgeous willow trees close to amenities and camp kitchen.
The oven river back onto tue caravan park was a short walk .
There is a games room, amentities modern and clean.
Our friends were happy too find a coffee van present in the morning.
Overall very happy with our stay.
Appeared family friendly, welcoming.
Guest carpark.

title: Great icon
text:
We were staying in Robe and took the road trip to Kingston SE.
I was last at Kingston 22 yrs ago, was so lovely to see the big lobster still there.
I had heard from a local in Robe that someone from the West wanted to buy it and move it.
Worth the stop,worth staying where its meant too

title: Beautiful park lovely hosts
text:
We booked last minute and Kerryn helped us out with getting a lovely powered site with our caravan.
Lovely bush type setting 5 mins drive into town
Grassy areas, jumping pillow for kids, camp kitchen and clean amenities.
Close to bike path and drive to beaches
TV reception wasnt great for us but the reception have gold coin donation DVD hire.
Not that I drink coffee, but there is a little coffee caravan daily for those that need their fix
Beautiful mulberry trees in the park
Would highly recommend this park its very family friendly.
Thanks for a wonderful stay

title: Disappointing booking system
text:
We arrived at the national park to go on a tour
The lady at reception informed us that all tours must be booked online 24hrs prior to the tour.
We got to go on a self guided tour in a smaller cave
Be prepared dont miss out by not booking online
Surroundings gorgeous
Staff friendly

title: Lovely surroundings
text:
Went there boxing day with family too look at the new playground
Lovely paths, lakes and playground
Gorgeous large trees full of shade
Nice spot too picnic

title: Value for money
text:
My family ate here on a Sunday for my mothers birthday.
There were 14 people attending.
When we arrived at the restaurant the crowd was overwhelming, straight away I thought there will be a lengthy wait for meals.
We were greeted by friendly staff, seated and given our menu.
Lots of assorted dishes to choose from, well priced and large servings.
I ordered the calamari salad and couldnt finish it.
Our meals arrived altogether and all 14 guests were very happy with what they had ordered.
The provided colouring books and pencils to entertain the kids.
Be aware there is a cakeage fee of $2 per person and eating here for the first time this was waived by the manager.
Cant wait to return to try out the breakfast menu.
Thanks for a great dining experience

title: Lux was a disappointment
text:
My partner and i tried the Lux hoyts cinema at Eastland last evening
On arrival staff were slow to service our needs
The food was so over priced compared to Village gold class.
My toberlone cocktail was delivered in a drinking normal sized glass, they forgot our pizza and chicken bites and when delivered was cold !!!!
Waitresses werent quite when moving about the cinema
Thank goodness the movie was good we wont be back

title: A beauty amongst the gum trees
text:
Thanks to Chris and Lynn for their welcoming hospitality.
You should be extremely proud of your professionalism, attention too detail and wonderfully decorated rooms.
The rooms are spacious with all the modern necessities, we loved the extras like the robes and warm blankets.
Double shower and plenty of hot water.
Beds have electric blankets if needed with comfy mattress and pillows.
There is a kitchenette at easy access, extra toilet for guests and a lovely sitting room with an abundance of books, views of the river, coffee, wine and chocolates.
Nothing is a bother for the hosts, we took our bikes as there were some nice trails to explore both west and east.
Overall a lovely getaway and the weather and company made it more appealing.
Highly recommend

title: Mans dream shed
text:
Took my partner here today because it was rated top thing to do in Echuca
Neil was very friendly and made us feel comfortable and engaged
Looks of garagalia and lots of beer cans
Variety of things to look at
Loved his memorial for his late father
Overall great morning lots of history lots of laughs and loads of quirky things

title: Wonderful experience
text:
We booked a couples body scrub and 60 minute massage...
Wonderful staff
Amazing massage
Clean modern facilities
Communication excellent
Felt great afterwards
Would highly recommend

title: Sunset bar
text:
Our tuk tuk drove us too this view point as i read this view point was number one in Phuket for a sunset
Small bar a little grubby, drinks ok prices
Very steep for cars or bikes
Friendly staff
Sunset was covered by clouds tonight but still gorgeous views
Thought this place would be romantic but was busy with mainly men hanging around the bar

title: Atmosphere friendly
text:
You are greeted by a very little man in as green leprechaun suit saying happy happy as you enter the pub.
He chats to patrons, bar staff friendly but i thought our nachos were boring and basic
Drinks on the dearer side
Alot of people watching from the bar stools just down the road for Hooters
Leprechaun happy to have a pic taken

title: Breathtakingly beautiful and ethical in everyway
text:
We arrived at the Sanctuary after being picked up from our hotel in Kata Beach.
On arrival we checked in and staff guided us as to what the afternoon looked like.
A group of around 50 people , got to pat and feed the elephants, then swim and bathe with them.
This experience was so unique, was extremely safe and helps protect the elephants.
This park is ethical in everyway.
The elephants are free to roam and not chained or whipped.
I refuse to ride any sort of animals and alot of these have been rescused from trekking up too 9 hrs a day.
Staff are there to photograph the experience and free too download from the website.
Nice buffet lunch and hot showers.
Very cheap for what you get.
Loved every moment.
They are gentle, majestic animals.

title: Poor service
text:
We arrived for our last 3 days kn Patong
I had booked through booking.com and werent aware of their holding policy of a credit card or $2500 tbt
The staff were not at all flexible, wasnt happy to leave my credit card with them, the refused the hold of our passports
They didnt encourage us to stay, felt like they were unfriendly and not accommadating
Not a good experience for us
The first time we have come across this policy in Patong
Do yourself a favour and look at the hotel policy dont get trapped like we did
We then had to find further accommadation last minute which our last resort were more than accommadating

title: Magical place
text:
Located in the heart of Kata Beach
Staff friendly and upgraded our room on arrival
Need to put $2500 tbt as a hold or $100 US dollars, we gave our passports
Surroundings are stunning both day and night
Lots of lanterns, candles, lights and art
Very exotic
Room was so impressive
Huge ceilings
King bed
Modern dump shower that enters out into swimming pool
Large pool
Swim up bar
Very romantic
Best place we have stayed in Phuket

title: Great beach easy location
text:
Great beach
Can hire sun lounge for $100tbt per person
Safe ocean to swim in if you dont go too far
Life guards on duty
Paragliding if you like
Massages and drinks can be bought along the beach
Our belongings were left on the chair while we swam and completly safe

title: Nice place
text:
Very happy customers
Very conveniently located close to Koh Yao Yai village resort
People very friendly
Meal tasty and very fresh
Drinks cheap
Pina colada 130tbt compared too 290 other places
Can sit outdoor or under cover
On main road

title: Beautiful fresh food
text:
Welcomed
Shoes must be taken off
No alcohol served here
Meals cheap, large and fresh
Staff friendly
Toilet available
Has nice ocean views
Close too main pier

title: Needs revamping
text:
Went to see Cobra show
Staff friendly
Didnt like surroundings for animals
Small cages , need updating
Only people for cobra show
Went for around 15 mins
Commentator was very hard too understand
Expected tip money after paying 500tbt an adult
Not a place I would visit again
Talented staff
place: Phuket Cobra Show and Snake Farm

title: Overwhelming romantic
text:
My partner and I wanted to get out from the hussle and bussle of the mainland.
We arrived to Koh Yao Yai island via speed boat...the trip was very smooth..i suffer seasickness but this was completely fine.
Transport is via tuk tuk to your hotel.
When we arrived to Koh Yao Yai village the first thing we noticed were the friendly staff. Greeted us with a cold towel and drink. We then were taken to our room.
Room 105 deluxe villa was so well positioned. Outdoor area with sun lounges, day bed and fridge. Indoor was flawless...i emailed ahead to say could you please make the room look romantic.
To our surprise on arrival it had happy honeymoon on our bed !!!
Large comfortable bed, outdoor shower, beach bag and beach towels.
This place has been my fav by far. The pools are amazing its a 5 min walk to the beach
Drinks at swim up bar are very pricey, breakfast included in price, restaurant also a bit pricey but lovely food.
Can get a motorbike hire on the island for 200-250tbt for a day.
Tours can be booked directly through the hotel.
If you are looking to have some well deserved R & R this is the place to go.
Very quiet only a few people around

title: Serenity
text:
My partner and I booked last minute for a well deserved break.
We decided on the Burasari for our first 4 nights due to the size of the place (resort not too big ) location and the look of tranquility.
It is a 5 minute walk from Patong beach , 10 min walk to Bangala road, close too markets and easy access to transport.
Staff are very welcoming and friendly
Breakfast has a wide selection included in price
Room was a little smaller than i expected but still very comfortable with king sized bed.
Two pools , swim up bar, pool room, safe in rooms, spa retreat and diner facilities.
Traditional thai dancers three days a week in dining area.
Happy hour
Peaceful and not over crowded
Unfortunately there is nil gym but 5 min walk best gym in Patong beach

title: Great facilities
text:
My partner and i love exercise and unfortunately the hotel we were staying at didnt have gym facilities....im glad
We discovered the facility was only a 5 min walk from our hotel.
Staff were so friendly
Gym is large
Offers crossfit, open gym and muay thai classes
Can purchase daily entry while on holiday or cheaper to buy weekly
Very clean
Air con
Take own towel and water

title: Great dog friendly bushwalks
text:
Took my two dogs exploring here
Not many people about
Beautiful picnic areas
Tomahawk creek walk very scenic
Lots of different bush tracks to explore
Kiln and historical markers interesting

title: Greens Bush
text:
I hiked from Greens bush through too Baldrys crossing car park return
It was very scenic, beautiful landscape, lots of wildlife and well maintained tracks
It was a 14km return hike, which I felt safe on my own doing
Not that steep, quite easy walking, would be good for families

title: Colourful wonderland
text:
My partner and I spent a few hours wandering through the blue lotus gardens
There was so many interesting plants, lotus , lillies and tropical trees.
It was well maintained in some sections and others needed some much needed weeding and maintenance think the entrance price for an adult was quite expensive
BYO food and drinks or there is a cafe
Toilets and bbq facilities
Nice river walk

title: Fun day
text:
We booked the reef sprinter as we both can be prone too sea sickness.
This trip is not only quick but a fun way to arrive to Low Isles.
Both the skipper and crew member were very friendly and informative.
We both felt extremely safe while snorkelling and travelling on the boat.
It was the perfect amount of time on the reef, which with the help of the floatation device made it more enjoyable.
We did look funny in our lycra onsies but it was a bit of piece of mind knowing stingers may be around
Our skipper also took us on a brief tour around Low Isles and showed us points of interest.
Overall very happy choice of tour
No lunch or morning tea provided

title: Bump track
text:
My partner and I set out for a challenge on the Bump track.
A good level of fitness is required due to the steep descent
Great diverse landscape and informative signage along the way
Take hat sunscreen and plenty of water
Its lovely to be able to walk where there has been alot of history

title: Great experience
text:
We enjoyed a lovely style pub meal
Value for money
Need too book over busy season due too popularity
Have cane toad racing at the back of the pub from 8pm
Tickets $5 a person, lots of laughs
Host very good at his job
Highly recommend for something different

title: Fantastic day
text:
My partner and I had a fantastic time with our tour guide Jens
This tour showed us life in both the Daintree and Cape Tribulation.
Jens was a very informative and knowledgeable guide who was also both friendly and welcoming.
I liked the diversity of landscape and places visited.
From river cruises, too lookouts, too waterfalls and photo opportunities on the way..
Our last stop was at an ice creamery which was a refreshing experience post rainforest hike.
The catering was abundant and well organised, catering for any dietary requirement.
We loved the refreshing dip in Noahs creek, we didnt have crowds and with a small group we never had too wait for people.
I would highly recommend this tour for anyone wishing to get off the beaten track and experience amazing places and scenery
Well worth the money and early start
Comfortable air con bus
Thanks again Jens...
place: Daintree Rainforest, Cape Tribulation, Mossman Gorge Small-Group Day Tour

title: Not my cup of tea
text:
We decided to catch a cab to the market and realised on arrival it really wasnt the type of market we enjoyed
Rows and rows of food, trinkets, clothes and more trinkets.
It was colourful i will give it that..
We were warned there are pick pocketers at this market and they steal gold jewellery from around marketers neck.
My partner and I both felt completely safe but really only spent 10 mins in there.

title: Quite confronting
text:
Impact was overwhelming
Lots of graphic pictures
Lots to read about
Very visual
Entry cheap, beware begger with one arm asking for money on admission

title: Ok accommadation
text:
Situated in district one was a plus for us
Room seemed dated
Shower over the bath which is something i dont like
Bed really uncomfortable two single beds pushed together
Breakfast wasnt as flash as other hotels we had stayed at
Overall cleanliness was great
Staff friendly
Didnt use facilities- not much in the way of gym equipment

title: Great day out on the water
text:
Both myself and partner were time poor when researching best ways to see the Meekong delta
When I saw this tour, it ticked alot of our boxes and more
Communication was fantastic with Les Rives, we secured a spot with less than a weeks notice
Our adventure began with an early morning start at 8am picked up in an air con bus that held around 16 people
We arrived at the dock loaded up in life jackets and set off on a memorable day
Food was offered throught the trip along with refreshments
Staff and the crew were friendly spoke great English and were very informative
Lunch was amazing and plentiful, we got too drink some wine samples too
I loved we meandered through a market, visited both a temple and pargoda and met with a village family and rowed via wooden boats through a canal
Despite it raining at one stage we were supplied with raincoats and traditonal hats to keep us dry
Overall private small group
A little dearer than other tours but worth every cent
Experience life on the delta up close and personal
Highly recommend this mode of transport to see an amazing river

title: Mua caves
text:
Not much to see in the way of caves but we came here to do the ancient 500 steps
My partner and I have a good level of fitness and found these ok to climb
The heat got in our way but stopped a few times to take magnificent pictures snd wipe the sweat away
Would recommend doing this in the earliest part of the day yo avoid the heat
Stunning views
Gardens surrounding peaceful
Highly recommend if you enjoy a challenge
